result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:42 PM; Case called for Status conference.  Defendant Carl A Rennells appeared by Zoom video, in custody at KMCI.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Carl A Rennells.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Rypel provides an update; he notes parties are still prepared to resolve the matter and is asking the matter be set for plea and sentencing in December.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Kettle Moraine Correctional for the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Per email communication with Transport KMCI would not release defendant on the OTP due to medical reasons.  Clerk also contacted KMCI to see if video was possible for the 9/22/2022 P/S hearing and was advised defendant would not be available.  Clerk has email out to counsel to see how they want to proceed.

Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed, to be produced from Dodge Correctional Institution for the 09/22/2022 Plea/sentencing hearing.

10:04 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Carl A Rennells in court by telephone, in custody at DCI, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rypel provides an update, he notes he has received the blood test results and is asking the matter be set for plea and sentencing in September.  State advises they have filed an amended information.  Atty. Rypel advises he has not seen the amended information.  Court provides a copy to Atty. Rypel.  Atty. Rypel acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing in September.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from DCI for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Amended Information filed by the State.
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:41 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Carl A Rennells in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Dodge Correctional, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Rypel provides an update, his client would like to have the matter set for plea and sentencing but they are still waiting on the blood test results.  State confirms they have not received them yet so there is no offer.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 45 days, if the blood test result come in before the next date and counsel wants to change the hearing to plea and sentencing he should just file a letter with the clerk's office.  Defendant to appear by video from Dodge Correctional for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Allow Remote Appearance filed by Atty. Rypel.  **Defendant is already set up to appear by video from DCI by the Clerk's office; Atty. Rypel to be notified.** (am)
Detainer placed at: DCI

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.    Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.
